org.wikiutils

Class LoginUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wikiutils.LoginUtils

  • public class LoginUtils
extends Object
    Contains a few useful login methods
    Author:
    Fastily
    See Also:
    CollectionUtils, DateUtils, GUIUtils, IOUtils, ParseUtils, StringUtils, WikiUtils

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void guiLogin(Wiki wiki)
      Login with loginAndSetPrefs(), but using a GUI.
      static void loginAndSetPrefs(Wiki wiki, String user, char[] p)
      Generic login method which turns off maxlag and throttle.
      static String[] showLoginScreen(String title)
      Creates and shows user a login screen, returning user login details in a String array.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • loginAndSetPrefs

        public static void loginAndSetPrefs(Wiki wiki,
                                    String user,
                                    char[] p)
        Generic login method which turns off maxlag and throttle. Catches IOExceptions 8 times, and then exits program.
        Parameters:
        wiki - Wiki object to perform changes on
        user - User to login as, without "User:" prefix
        p - User's password, in the form of a char array.

      • guiLogin

        public static void guiLogin(Wiki wiki)
        Login with loginAndSetPrefs(), but using a GUI. Throttle auto-set to 12 edits/min.
        Parameters:
        wiki - Wiki object to perform changes on
        See Also:
        loginAndSetPrefs(Wiki, String, char[])

      • showLoginScreen

        public static String[] showLoginScreen(String title)
        Creates and shows user a login screen, returning user login details in a String array. Does not check to see if login details are valid.
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the login window
        Returns:
        An array of length 2, in the form {username, password}.
